intro: Chorizanthe fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed choris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, spiny bracts. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense, spiny structures, often giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Chorizanthe fimbriata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands, dunes, and disturbed areas.
